alert.note: Alert for Eastern Ulster; Western Ulster (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 3:18PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Ulster County through 345 PM EDT... At 318 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Woodland Valley Campground, or 14 miles south of Hunter, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, nickel size hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Heavy rains could cause ponding of water on roads and in urban and poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Kingston, Saugerties, Hurley, Woodstock, Woodland Valley Campground, West Shokan, Kenneth L Wilson Campground, Lake Katrine, Phoenicia, West Hurley, Saugerties South, Mount Tremper, Olivebridge, Port Ewen, Esopus, Marbletown, Veteran, Centerville, Rolling Meadows and Maple Hill. This includes Interstate 87 between exits 19 and 20. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for east central New York.
